title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
description: Given a sorted array nums, remove the duplicates in-place such that each element appears only once and returns the new length of the array. Do not allocate extra space for another array; you must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory. The elements beyond the new length do not matter.

examples.explanation: Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 1 and 2 respectively. It does not matter what you leave beyond the returned length.
Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums being 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively.

constraints: nums is sorted in ascending order.

output.description: The new length of the array after removing duplicates. The input array `nums` is modified in-place.
